alert.note: Alert for Coastal Bay; Coastal Gulf; South Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 08 at 4:23AM EST until January 10 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM EST /3 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM EST /10 AM CST/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of up to 12 feet expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...Walton, Bay, and Gulf County Beaches. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Wednesday night. For the High Surf Warning, from 4 PM EST /3 PM CST/ this afternoon to 11 AM EST /10 AM CST/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Bay; Coastal Gulf; South Walton
